author: Afshan Yasmeen
text:
The minimum qualification for a Group ‘D’ post in the Karnataka Health Department: SSLC pass. The qualification of some successful applicants during the recent recruitment drive: BE, post-graduation.

Clearly indicating that a government job, at any level, is still preferred to a job in a private company, at least two engineering graduates and four postgraduates have been selected for Group ‘D’ posts in the Health Department.

Selected from among 91,548 candidates who had applied for 1,582 vacant Group ‘D’ posts in the Hyderabad Karnataka region, the highly qualified candidates have undergone counselling and are waiting for their appointment letters.

The Health Department invited online applications for these posts in April and, after selection on merit basis, counselling for the selected candidates was done in the first week of January. As many as 263 candidates did not attend the counselling.

State Health Commissioner P.S. Vastrad, who confirmed to The Hindu that these candidates had been selected for Group ‘D’ posts.

Stating that the scenario was the same across the country, the Commissioner said the number of engineering colleges and engineers were on the rise.

“It is difficult to get jobs. Candidates from the lower strata of society who do not have a strong family support are desperate to get a job,” he said.

They are waiting for appointment letters to join the Karnataka Health Department
title: Engineers, post-graduates vie for Karnataka Group ‘D’ posts
